page.title: 12TATSFIELD LIGHT RAILWAY.
page.content: In 1898 there was a scheme to build a branch light railway line from Orpington on the South Eastern and Chatham Railway out to Tatsfield. A Â£light' railway could be built to lower engineering standards because the speed of trains was limited to 25 m.p.h. It did not require a special Act of Parliament but the scheme had to be approved by Commisioners under the Light Railways Act of 1896. The line was over seven miles long. Four stations were scheduled; Green Street Green, Cudham Valley, Biggin Hill and Tatsfield. Biggin Hill Station was sited near the Fox and Hounds with a level crossing over the Westerham Road. The route was confirmed on 10 June 1902 but the funds were never found.
